Hi all,

a colleague of mine once told me that she never did unit testing. =
Her 
argument was that unit tests, as performed today, are able to check 
o=
nly a specific path on the code, the path stablished by initial 
conditions=
. Instead, she performed specificacion checking using 
theorem provers and =
other advanced tools. This has made me think 
about the utility of unit tes=
ting and the level of code reliability 
that unit testing can provide.

Wha=
t do you have to say about this? Could it have an impact on unit 
testing a=
nd, specifically, on JUnit?

Look forward to hearing from you.
